meanings.definition: A fine mist of liquid particles in the air.
meanings.sent1: The spray from the waterfall felt refreshing on my face.
meanings.sent2: The gardener used a spray to water the plants gently.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child ran through the spray of the sprinkler, laughing.
meanings.sent4: The spray of stars in the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The spray of perfume lingered in the room long after she left.

meanings.definition: To disperse liquid in small drops.
meanings.sent1: She likes to spray water on the flowers to keep them hydrated.
meanings.sent2: The painter used a brush to spray paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally sprayed sauce all over the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The sprinkler sprayed water in all directions, creating a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The skunk sprayed a foul odor to defend itself from predators.

meanings.definition: A device that emits a fine mist of liquid.
meanings.sent1: The spray helped cool down the room on hot summer days.
meanings.sent2: She carried a small spray in her bag for quick touch-ups.
meanings.sent3: The automatic air freshener released a pleasant spray every hour.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic used a spray to lubricate the gears of the machine.
meanings.sent5: The spray bottle dispensed the cleaning solution evenly on the surface.

meanings.definition: To apply liquid in small drops.
meanings.sent1: He would spray cologne on his wrists before going out.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sprayed fertilizer on the crops for better growth.
meanings.sent3: She sprayed a bit of perfume on her scarf for a lovely scent.
meanings.sent4: The artist sprayed water on the paint to create a watercolor effect.
meanings.sent5: The gardener sprayed insecticide on the plants to protect them from pests.
